nz.co.jedsimson.lgp.core.program.registers

Class ArrayRegisterSet<TData>

  • nz.co.jedsimson.lgp.core.program.registers.ArrayRegisterSet<TData>
  • Type Parameters:
    TData -

    The type of the value that each register contains.

    All Implemented Interfaces:
    RegisterSet<TData>

    public class ArrayRegisterSet<TData>
implements RegisterSet<TData>

    An implementation of interface RegisterSet that uses an array as the register store.

    See Also:
    interface RegisterSet

    • Constructor Detail

      • ArrayRegisterSet

        public ArrayRegisterSet(int inputRegisters,
                        int calculationRegisters,
                        @NotNull
                        java.util.List<? extends TData> constants,
                        @NotNull
                        DefaultValueProvider<? extends TData> defaultValueProvider)

        Creates a new class ArrayRegisterSet with the specified parameters.

        Parameters:
        inputRegisters - Number of registers reserved for input values from a data set instance.
        calculationRegisters - Number of registers reserved for calculations (i.e. free registers).
        constants - A collection of constants to be stored in read-only constant registers.
        defaultValueProvider - An implementation that can provide default values for the calculation registers.
        See Also:
        class ArrayRegisterSet

        @NotNull
public Register<TData> register(int index)

        Get the class Register with the given index.

        Parameters:
        index - The index of the desired register.
        Throws:
        RegisterReadException - When index is out-of-bounds of the register set.

      • apply

        public void apply(int index,
                  @NotNull
                  kotlin.jvm.functions.Function1<? super TData,? extends TData> modifier)

        Applies the given modifier to the value of the class Register at index.

        Parameters:
        index - The register to modify the value of.
        modifier - A function that modifies the value in the register.
        Throws:
        RegisterReadException - When index is out-of-bounds of the register set.
        See Also:
        modifier, class Register, index

      • get

        public TData get(int index)

        Get the value the of the register at the given index.

        Parameters:
        index - The register to read from.
        Throws:
        RegisterReadException - When index is out-of-bounds of the register set.

      • set

        public void set(int index,
                TData value)

        Sets the value of the register at the given index.

        Parameters:
        index - The register to write to.
        value - The value to write to the register.
        Throws:
        RegisterAccessException - When the index refers to a constant register.

      • overwrite

        public void overwrite(int index,
                      TData value)

        Forcefully sets the value or the register with the given index.

        This method has similar functionality to the RegisterSetset method but does not check the type of the register -- allowing constant registers to be overwritten without exception.

        Parameters:
        index - The register to write to.
        value - The value to write to the register.
        See Also:
        index, RegisterSetset

      • writeInstance

        public void writeInstance(@NotNull
                          Sample<TData> data)

        Writes an instance from some data set to the register sets input registers.

        NOTE: The number of input registers of the set must match the number of features in the instance.

        Parameters:
        data - An instance to write to the input registers.
        Throws:
        RegisterWriteRangeException - When the number of features does not match the number of input registers.

      • registerType

        @NotNull
public RegisterType registerType(int index)

        Determines the type of the register with the given index.

        Parameters:
        index - The index of the register whose type is desired.
        See Also:
        index

      • reset

        public void reset()

        Resets the input and calculation registers to their default values.
